thread.title: Every Single Emotion You Felt During That Gut-Wrenching This Is Us Episode
thread.title_full: Every Single Emotion You Felt During That Gut-Wrenching This Is Us Episode

author: Kelsie Gibson
title: Every Single Emotion You Felt During That Gut-Wrenching This Is Us Episode
text:
Reactions to William's Death on This Is Us Every Single Emotion You Felt During That Gut-Wrenching This Is Us Episode February 22, 2017 12 Shares 
Warning: MAJOR spoilers ahead. 
This Is Us is known for making us bawl our eyes out, but the latest episode really took the cake. After teasing it all season long, Randall's biological father, William, lost his battle with cancer during Tuesday night's episode. While the cast was certainly emotional about the beloved character's bittersweet goodbye, some of the best (and most relatable) reactions came from the fans. See some of the best moments on social media right here. This is the most perfect episode of television that I have EVER seen. #ThisIsUs 
â€” Danielle Kelley (@DanielleRkelley) February 22, 2017 This episode is brutal. It's beautiful.... But dang.... It's brutal #ThisIsUs 
â€” Patience Harjo (@patience_harjo) February 22, 2017 5 minutes into #ThisIsUs and already crying. This is gonna be fun! 
â€” Lynne Gentry (@Lynne_Gentry) February 22, 2017 How am I supposed to deal with Jacks death if I'm still emotionally drained from Willams death. #ThisIsUs pic.twitter.com/XPVthFQ9uG 
â€” B Barb. (@Barbadelic) February 22, 2017 Never have I ever loved a character as much as William. My heart feels a little broken, and my living floor a little flooded. #ThisIsUs 
â€” Momma Bear (@NewMommaBear) February 22, 2017 Sobbed uncontrollably at William's death on #ThisIsUs , I have no clue how to prepare for Jack's. Will there be grief counseling for fans? 
â€” Brittany Lights (@BLights_) February 22, 2017 trying to take deep breathes right along with Randall and William.. i just can'tðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­ #ThisIsUs 
â€” Cami Scroggins (@camiiiishae) February 22, 2017 Damn, #ThisIsUs broke me down last night. Beautiful story, and excellent #writing but man, was that upsetting. pic.twitter.com/UGrTFJy5M5 
â€” David Del Toro (@deltoro27) February 22, 2017 Related:
